alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:28PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HEAVY AND PROLONGED RAINFALL HAS AFFECTED CENTRAL PUTNAM...KANAWHA...SOUTHWESTERN ROANE...NORTHWESTERN RALEIGH...SOUTHWESTERN CLAY...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON...NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE AND NORTHEASTERN BOONE COUNTIES... Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, Poca, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Pratt, Pinch and Powellton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 22. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 122. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 41 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 64 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 69 and 80. Heavy rain may cause ponding of water on roadways and flooding in low-lying areas. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Roane
